title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow, Technology, 3 positions, Tampere Institute for Advanced Study (Tampere IAS)
job_description: Tampere University was launched in 2019, when the University of Tampere and Tampere University of Technology merged to become Finland's second largest university. Our focus areas are technology, health, and society. The new university aims at scientific excellence and societal impact in research. The university regards the competence of staff as its most important strategic asset and supports its development. For further information, please visit www.tuni.fi/en. As a university-level initiative to boost scientific excellence, Tampere University launched the Tampere Institute for Advanced Study in 2021. The purpose of the Institute is to provide researchers from all the scientific fields in the above focus areas an opportunity to concentrate on conducting research of highest quality and thus advance to their next career stage. To this end, the Institute grants fixed-term Postdoctoral, Senior and Professorial Fellowships.  The Tampere Institute for Advanced Study is a university-level research community offering the most competitive researchers the opportunity to focus on their own research and take it to the next level as well as broaden their research horizon. The Institute grants Fellowships to researchers in all scientific fields represented at Tampere University. The Institute also invites leading international researchers for short visits, collaborates with similar institutes and organizes scientific events. Its activities are tightly connected with the research conducted in the faculties of Tampere University. The Tampere Institute for Advanced Study now calls for applications for nine (9) two-year, fixed-term and full-time Postdoctoral Research Fellow positions starting on 1 September 2022 and ending on 31 August 2024. We are also calling for applications for Senior Research Fellowships in a separate job posting. Please note that you are allowed to submit only one (1) application either for the Postdoctoral Research Fellowship or the Senior Research Fellowship after choosing the one that best fits your current academic career path, and in one (1) focus area (technology, health or society) only. The positions are based in Tampere where the appointed Fellows are expected to be primarily physically present after the current pandemic has subsided. Please note that the appointed Fellows may also be expected to give postgraduate education of their field (up to 5% of total working hours).  Eligibility and evaluation of applicants To be eligible to apply for these Postdoctoral Research Fellowships you must have completed your doctoral degree no more than five (5) years ago. You must have received your doctoral certificate dated before the application closing date 7 March 2022. Applications for these Postdoctoral Research Fellow positions are evaluated on the basis of scientific quality and ambition of the work plans demonstrated in the application documents.  Applications for both postdoctoral and senior positions will be assessed against the following key evaluation criteria. High academic quality and innovativeness of the work plan Feasibility of the work plan Specific benefits offered by Tampere University as the research environment for implementing your work plan Shortlisted applications will be sent to external evaluators for peer review. Please note that interviews will not be conducted. We offer We offer a research-inspiring work environment with an excellent up-to-date infrastructure and a collaborative work community in three modern campuses, as well as high-quality support services for researchers.
